intro: Ternstroemia purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth surface and a pointed tip. Ternstroemia purpusii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
